text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to mention that US courts apply the \"manifest disregard of the law\" doctrine only in domestic arbitration and not in foreign award enforcement under the New York Convention. The candidate answer mentions the doctrine in Section I.1, stating that deference is due unless there is \"manifest disregard of the law or clear excess of authority,\" and again in Section II (Counterarguments), stating the FAA ยง 10(a)(4) standard is high and the tribunal did not \"manifestly disregard the law.\" This suggests the doctrine *is* relevant or applicable, which contradicts the specific requirement of the criterion (that it is *not* applied in foreign award enforcement under the NY Convention). The response fails to explicitly state the distinction required by the criterion.", "criterion_id": "0b829d90-0ded-4a7c-9508-72d4252c8baa"}
